name: Espresso
recipe_steps: Grind fresh coffee beans to a fine consistency.
Tamp 7–9 g of coffee into the portafilter.
Brew a single shot (≈30 ml) using an espresso machine.
Serve immediately.

name: Americano
recipe_steps: Prepare a shot of espresso (30–60 ml depending on size).
Pour hot water (90–210 ml depending on size) into a cup.
Add the espresso to the hot water.
Serve immediately.

name: Macchiato
notes: Espresso with a small amount of milk foam.
recipe_steps: Prepare a shot of espresso.
Steam a small amount of milk and create foam.
Add a dollop of milk foam on top of the espresso.
Serve immediately.

name: Cappuccino
notes: Equal parts espresso, steamed milk, and foam.
recipe_steps: Prepare a shot of espresso.
Steam milk to about 60°C (140°F).
Froth milk to create thick foam.
Pour steamed milk over espresso, then spoon foam on top.
Serve immediately.

name: Latte
notes: Creamy espresso drink with lots of steamed milk.
recipe_steps: Prepare a shot of espresso.
Steam milk to about 60°C (140°F).
Pour steamed milk over the espresso, holding back the foam.
Add a small layer of foam on top.
Serve immediately.

name: Flat White
notes: Strong coffee-to-milk ratio with silky microfoam.
recipe_steps: Prepare a double shot of espresso (60 ml).
Steam milk to create velvety microfoam.
Pour milk over espresso, mixing evenly, with minimal foam on top.
Serve immediately.

name: Iced Coffee
notes: Regular brewed coffee served cold over ice.
recipe_steps: Brew coffee using drip or pour-over method.
Allow coffee to cool slightly.
Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour coffee over ice.
Add milk or sweetener if desired and stir.

name: Cold Brew
notes: Slow-steeped cold coffee diluted to taste.
recipe_steps: Coarsely grind coffee beans (≈1:8 ratio coffee to water).
Steep coffee in cold water for 12–24 hours in a container.
Strain coffee through a fine mesh or filter.
Pour over ice and dilute with water or milk to taste.
Serve immediately.

name: Nitro Cold Brew
notes: Nitrogen-infused cold brew with creamy texture.
recipe_steps: Prepare cold brew coffee concentrate.
Infuse nitrogen using a nitro tap or canister.
Pour nitro cold brew into a glass without stirring.
Serve chilled with creamy texture.

name: Iced Latte
notes: Espresso poured over milk and ice.
recipe_steps: Prepare a shot of espresso.
Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour espresso over ice.
Add cold milk (proportional to size).
Stir gently and serve.

name: Frappuccino
notes: Blended iced coffee with milk and syrup.
recipe_steps: Brew espresso or instant coffee and allow it to cool.
Add coffee, milk, sweetener/syrup, and crushed ice to a blender.
Blend until smooth and frothy.
Pour into a glass and optionally top with whipped cream.

name: Turkish Coffee
notes: Thick, unfiltered coffee brewed in a cezve.
recipe_steps: Add finely ground coffee, water, and sugar (if desired) to a cezve.
Stir well to mix.
Heat slowly over low heat until it foams and just before boiling.
Remove from heat, pour into cup, and allow grounds to settle.
Serve without filtering.

name: Arabic Coffee
notes: Light roast coffee with cardamom, traditionally unsweetened.
recipe_steps: Add lightly roasted coffee and cardamom to a small pot with water.
Bring slowly to a simmer over low heat.
Remove from heat and pour carefully into small cups.
Serve hot and traditionally without sugar.

name: Vietnamese Coffee
notes: Strong, sweet coffee often served iced.
recipe_steps: Place ground coffee into a Vietnamese drip filter (phin) over a cup.
Pour hot water and allow coffee to drip slowly.
Mix with sweetened condensed milk to taste.
Serve hot or pour over ice for iced version.

name: Greek Coffee
notes: Unfiltered coffee brewed in a briki with foam ('kaimaki').
recipe_steps: Add finely ground coffee, water, and sugar to a briki.
Stir and heat slowly until it foams but before boiling.
Pour carefully into small cup, preserving the foam (‘kaimaki’).
Serve without filtering.

name: Cuban Coffee
notes: Espresso whipped with sugar into espuma.
recipe_steps: Brew a shot of espresso.
Whip sugar with a small amount of the first espresso drops until foamy.
Pour remaining espresso over the whipped sugar to create espuma.
Serve immediately.

name: Irish Coffee
notes: Coffee with whiskey, sugar, and cream float.
recipe_steps: Brew hot coffee and pour into a warmed glass.
Add brown sugar and stir until dissolved.
Add whiskey and stir gently.
Float lightly whipped cream on top.
Serve hot.
